GapFillDragDrop.Title: Linking words / expressions
GapFillDragDrop.Instruction: Drag a word or phrase into the gaps to complete the sentences.

Content.Question:
1. We had hardly been in the house for five minutes when we heard a strange noise coming from the kitchen.
2. She changed her mind again, at which point I decided it was time to take matters into my own hands.
3. No sooner than we had mentioned his name, he called out of the blue.
4. Even though there was lots of people, it didn’t feel crowded at all.
5. In spite of being afraid of heights he was able to climb the wall in order to escape.
6. Much as I hate to break up a party, I really think it’s time we should leave.
7. They finally offered to increase the money, by which time it was too late.
8. Whilst Tom was preparing gourmet dishes in the kitchen, Kate just sat watching the television.
9. On hearing the news, we went straight to the school.
10. Hard though it may be, I think we need to make more of an effort to help poorer countries.
